page.title: 07Hollinhey C.P.School
page.content: On 9th April 1970,Hollinhey C.P.School opened on the closure of Sutton St.James' C.E.School and Langley C.P.School.Children come to it mainly from within the civil parish of Sutton.In 1973 it had nearly 250 pupils on roll but the number of children has steadily fallen owing to the decline in the national birthrate to just over 160.Today it has five full time teachers plus a headmaster,a caretaker and two cleaners,a cook and two assistants ,one classroom assistant and a clerical assistant for ten hours per week.Children start at the beginning of the term in which they will be five,most having previously attended St.James'Playgroup and at eleven go mainly to Macclesfield County High school although this year a larger number have opted for other county schools.
